issue.title: [Discussion] Metadata - How, Which & Where

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This is issue is to discuss the specifics of how and which metadata to save.
On previous issue #949 @ncw  mentioned the use of [BoltDB](https://github.com/boltdb/bolt) and from what I could find looking at embedded databases bolt seems like the best option. Since we are looking for a pure go implementation there are not many other options [goleveldb](https://github.com/syndtr/goleveldb), [tiedot](https://github.com/HouzuoGuo/tiedot) will probably work but leveldb feels like it will require more bootstrapping and tiedot doesn't seem as mature (both has seem to be a lot less popular than bolt).

So I think bolt should be the better choice but I never worked with any of the above some I'm open to suggestions.

As with which data to save -
hash 
Modification time 
file name (absolute path)

I think this is the bare minimum we need to save for anything useful. I'll think of a proper schema and upload it here once I have it a bit more finalized but i think of some relation between remotes might be useful.

I haven't done the schema yet but having the hash as one of the keys will probably be very useful. this means that we need to make sure it is unique and though SHA1 might be good enough I would much rather go with SHA256 but that might be a bit expensive to store and calculate especially for large files ( hashes being calculated for verifying the remote file would still be saved for cache and for verifying the remote file hasn't changed )  
If SHA256 is much less common than SHA1 with the remotes it might be worth using it and taking the almost non existent risk of collision 

When storing file path we still need to take into consideration that files might move on local filesystem/remote  #1331

We need to see how we handle dedupe files since they obviously going to have the same hash but might change independently in future runs

Versioning for db/records it might be useful to version the meta data so if we have any future schema changes migration wont be an issue

We need to see where to store the database file itself. rclone config path is probably the best place but we might want to offer a cmd flag to change the default

There are probably some more considerations I'm forgetting.

issue.title: [Feature Request] rclone mount: Cache the entire drive structure at startup, and add new files by monitoring Google's ChangeLog

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
[in reference to to this post on the rclone forum](https://forum.rclone.org/t/google-drive-quota-reached-seemingly-linked-to-folder-scanning/271) 

Excessively using queries seemingly results in exceeding Google Drive's quota, locking downloads for 24 hours. Caching the entire drive structure, and adding new files by periodically checking the Google Drive changelog should dramatically reduce the queries used. It would also significantly increase the speed which applications such as Plex, or Sonarr can check for new files by scanning every folder.

body: Watching. Would love to try a beta with this implemented.
I think partial responses require the v3 api and rclone is currently using the v2 api.

Ran out of time but I found the possible fields here: https://developers.google.com/apis-explorer/#p/drive/v2/drive.files.list

Will check back on tests once they finish running locally
Any idea when will this be fixed?

issue.title: Gdrive: partial responses by using explicit fields

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This solves #1346

The fields I included should be the absolute minimum required to pass the integration tests.

It only seemed to be applicable in listAll()

body:
I have merged @azgul patch in - thank you :-)

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.36-33-g7d9faff/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

I tried both sorts of integration tests and it worked fine for me - it could do with some real world testing too and some performance testing.

I did a rough before and after test like this

```
$ rclone ls drive:1000files -vv --dump-bodies 2>z-after
$ rclone-v1.36 ls drive:1000files -vv --dump-bodies 2>z-before
$ grep -v DEBUG z-before  | wc
 100991  187367 3719012
$ grep -v DEBUG z-after  | wc
  37967   70302 1227481
```

So the bytes used was reduced from 3.5M to 1.2M which is a reduction to 33% of the original size.
I tried to test this build, but ran into #1362 which appears unrelated to this change, because it also happened with the previous build 31.

Next update from @azgul - don't ask for owner info if not needed

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.36-34-g0d6e1af/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Seems like I encountered an issue with this. Starting from commit https://github.com/ncw/rclone/commit/d7df065320d180b4388e4366370974a30237f219 some folders are missing from the list, here's an example of how it should look (used commit https://github.com/ncw/rclone/commit/84d4d7f9d9dd5b8bf990b289c63bebe8251a3489)

> ./rclone lsd EGD:/ | grep Kamisama         
> -1 2016-11-25 18:42:37        -1 [Commie] Kamisama Hajimemashita [BD 720p AAC]
> -1 2016-11-23 23:02:07        -1 [Commie] Kamisama Hajimemashita 2 [BD 720p AAC]
> 
And here's how it looks with the latest commit:

> rclone lsd EGD:/ | grep Kamisama
> -1 2016-11-25 18:42:37        -1 [Commie] Kamisama Hajimemashita [BD 720p AAC]

And it's not the only folder missing either :(
Should I open a new issue?

@dfunkt That is reproducible before and after that commit?

What would be most useful is a dump with `-vv --dump-bodies` of your `lsd` command before and after.  You can email that to me if you want subject "rclone issue 1346" if you want as it will have lots of personal info in.

It's reproducible from commit https://github.com/ncw/rclone/commit/d7df065320d180b4388e4366370974a30237f219 to the latest one, commit https://github.com/ncw/rclone/commit/84d4d7f9d9dd5b8bf990b289c63bebe8251a3489 and below show everything just fine.
Also, email sent :)

I cannot reproduce your issue with my own gdrive account. `rclone lsd` for my gdrive produces the same output for me with the following rclone versions:
```
rclone v1.35-169-g320c53e
rclone v1.36
rclone-v1.36-33-g7d9faff
```

Everything has been uploaded from acd with `rclone v1.36`. About 300 folders at this point.

Something is off with latest beta
rclone size gdrive: is giving me wrong info

The website reports 60,3 TB ( correct / same value on ACD )

ACD FILES & SIZE (rclone size acd:/crypt)
Total objects: 46414
Total size: 61737.670 GBytes (66290318868698 Bytes)
24.04.2017/13:47 ACD: It took 201 seconds

GDRIVE FILE & SIZE (rclone size gdrive:/crypt)
Total objects: 40265
Total size: 39090.101 GBytes (41972676663843 Bytes)
24.04.2017/13:47 GDRIVE: It took  286 seconds


p.s. also rclone sync does not update mod times on gdrive for existing files (  its like default behavior is same as --no-update-modtime )
